title: Corporate Phishing Campaign - C-Suite Credential Harvesting
description: Targeted phishing assessment against executive team using Gophish and custom landing pages. Demonstrates effectiveness of sophisticated social engineering against high-value targets.
scenario: Security awareness assessment for financial services company. Client requested phishing simulation targeting executive team (C-suite and VPs) to measure susceptibility and identify training needs. Authorized engagement with full executive awareness and consent.

steps.expected_result: Identified 12 executives with LinkedIn profiles, email addresses, interests (golf, Harvard alumni), communication patterns
steps.explanation: OSINT provides personalization data for convincing pretexts

steps.action: Create personalized phishing campaign in Gophish
steps.expected_result: Campaign configured with 12 targets, personalized emails using {{.FirstName}}, branded Office 365 template
steps.explanation: Gophish enables tracking of opens, clicks, submissions

steps.expected_result: Pixel-perfect clone deployed at https://office-security-update.com, SSL certificate from Let's Encrypt
steps.explanation: Authentic appearance increases success rate significantly

steps.action: Send emails from spoofed IT Security address
steps.expected_result: 12 emails delivered successfully, SPF/DKIM passed, landed in inbox (not spam)
steps.explanation: Proper SPF alignment prevents spam filtering

steps.expected_result: After 4 hours: 10/12 opened (83%), 7/12 clicked (58%), 4/12 submitted credentials (33%)
steps.explanation: High success rate typical for targeted C-suite campaigns

steps.expected_result: Captured 4 sets of credentials including CFO (john.doe / P@ssw0rd123), CTO, VP Finance, VP Operations
steps.explanation: Demonstrates real-world impact of successful phishing

steps.expected_result: PDF report: 33% credential submission rate, recommendations for security awareness training, MFA enforcement, email security controls
steps.explanation: Comprehensive reporting demonstrates value and drives remediation

outcome: Successful demonstration of phishing vulnerability at executive level. 4 of 12 executives (33%) submitted credentials within 4 hours. CFO, CTO, and 2 VPs compromised. Zero executives reported suspicious email. Recommendations implemented: mandatory security awareness training for all executives, enforced MFA on all accounts, advanced email filtering with link rewriting, regular phishing simulations, executive-specific security briefings. Follow-up simulation 3 months later showed 90% reduction in credential submission (only 1 of 12 clicked).
